original_text:
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Asthmatic bronchitis with severe bronchospasm .
2. Acute sinusitis .
3. Allergic rhinitis .
4. Osteoporosis .
5. General anxiety disorder .
6. Depression .
7. Urge incontinence .
8. Oral candidiasis .
9. Gastroesophageal reflux disease .
10. Insomnia .
OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES :
1. Pulmonary function tests .
2. Computed tomography of the chest .
3. Computed tomography of the sinuses .
4. DuoNeb treatments .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Ceftin 500 mg twice a day for 10 days .
2. Albuterol inhaler 2 puffs __________
3. __________ for pain .
4. Calcium 500 mg twice a day .
5. Lasix 20 mg once a day .
6. Clonazepam 1 mg at bedtime .
7. Clarinex 5 mg once a day .
8. Guaifenesin 1 teaspoon every 6 hours p.r.n. for cough .
9. Prednisone 20 mg twice a day for 3 days , once a day for 3 days , and one every other day for 3 doses .
10. Nasonex nasal spray 1 spray each nostril once a day .
11. Singulair 10 mg once a day .
12. Prilosec 20 mg once a day .
13. Actonel 35 mg once a week .
14. Detrol LA 4 mg once a day .
15. Vivelle patch 0.5 mg twice a week .
16. Nystatin swish and swallow 1 teaspoon every 6 hours ; syrup 1 teaspoon every 6 hours .
DIET :
Regular .
ACTIVITIES :
As tolerated .
FOLLOWUP :
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in 3 days .
**INSTITUTION :
The patient was admitted with severe bronchospasm , wheezing , with persistent cough , resistant to outpatient with prednisone antibiotics .
She was placed on Solu - Medrol IV with IV antibiotics .
She responded to Solu - Medrol IV well .
She was also treated with DuoNeb treatments and oxygen for the severe bronchospasm .
The bronchospasm resolved gradually with Solu - Medrol and DuoNeb treatments .
CT did not show any infiltration and any abnormalities .
The CT of the sinuses showed chronic sinusitis and obstruction of the left sinuses as well .
She did feel better on **DATE[May 29 2007] , and **DATE[May 30 2007] .
Solu - Medrol was changed to prednisone , and she will be discharged home today with medications and discharge instructions , as per discharge form .
I will see her in my office , possibly referred to ENT doctor if she still has severe sinus problems .
I spent 45 minutes on discharge .
______________________________
**NAME[YYY ZZZ] , M.D.
HS Job # 156311 / 33677 / 36962
# **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[May 30 2007] 12:59
T :
**DATE[Jun 01 2007] 10:13
